sentence.Network_en: They've entered this new confederacy because the central government's been unable to control the collapsing economy.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于中央政府无力控制逐渐崩溃的经济，所以他们加入了这个新联盟。

sentence.Network_en: This bond of kin represented the real basis of the confederacy.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种血缘亲属关系是联盟的真实基础。

sentence.Network_en: Does the Confederacy mean nothing to you at all? "
sentence.Network_cn: 难道南部联盟对你就毫无意义?

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French confederacie, based on Latin confoederare 'join together in league' (see confederation)

entry.def: A confederacy is a union of states or people who are trying to achieve the same thing.

example.ex: They've entered this new confederacy because the central government's been unable to control the collapsing economy.
example.tran: 由于中央政府无力控制逐渐崩溃的经济，所以他们加入了这个新联盟。

means.word_mean: 2. a group of conspirators banded together to achieve some harmful or illegal purpose
3. a secret agreement between two or more people to perform an unlawful act
